reviewText: This bag does not impress me nor is it magical, but it does hold toiletries. The fact is, this bag is quite flimsy and it does not stand up on its own without being propped up against something.  This is an issue because the plastic hook meant for hanging the bag is rather small and won't fit around a thicker towel bar or a door handle.  If you can't hang it up because of the tiny hook it has, then it is not really a hanging toiletry bag.  The zippers do not have a nice quality feel and are not the easiest to use.  They are very jerky due to the flimsiness of the bag.  When you load up the bag it doesn't keep its shape and this adds to the zippers being difficult.  To be a great bag it would need a more solid structure, better zippers and a bigger hook not made of plastic.  Basically, if you just want a bag to hold your toiletries during transport this will do, if you like to use a toiletry bag to work out of and keep your stuff organized throughout your trip, keep looking.

ZIPPERS ARE MADE CHEAP AND BROKE IMMEDIATELY. The zipper that broke is second from the outside on the right, and it was on first use as I was just packing it. Other than that it is a good size compared to the others I've looked at. Still would have rather gotten this one (even though it looks smaller, I just don't have time to return and order another):

Neatpack Medium Size Hanging Nylon Toiletry Bag & Organizer with Detachable TSA Compliant Zipper Pocket and Swivel Style Hook | For Men & Women
http://www.amazon.com/Neatpack-Toiletry-Organizer-Detachable-Compliant/dp/B01CUTX3XE?ie=UTF8&dd=y-DutmZA2GhilqYhZd8yRg%2C%2C&ddc_refnmnt=pfod&keywords=toiletry%20bag&qid=1465443983&ref_=sr_1_7&refinements=p_97%3A11292772011%2Cp_72%3A2661618011&sr=8-7

I like the bag,  however it is small for my needs. You would think that a toiletry bag at almost $30 would b quite roomy-not so. The pic with the bottles of water sold me on the bag- very deceitful- you can get the bottles in there but there is NO way that it's closing, esp in the side pockets. So while the bag is cute, it's not as roomy as expected.
I bought this as a gift. We just tried to unzip it to use it for the first time and the zipper broke and fell off. Extremely disappointed.

While I was wanting a bag with a little more feminine look, I decided to purchase this toiletry bag from E-BLOOMY instead because of it's size, great reviews, and appearance; function over form.  I wanted a compartmentalized bag with a lot of room that was built to withstand rigorous handling.  This bag  is fairly large ( dimensions are noted in advertisement), and if one needs more room for toiletries they probably need to buy another type of bag. There is no room in this one for a number of large grooming items such as blow dryers, curling irons etc.  It is merely a toiletry bag, roomy for it's purposes, but limited to such.  The material is an attractive lush black, durable material, easy to clean or wipe off.  The zippers on this item are quality and function well with repeated use without snagging or tearing. There is a plastic hook for hanging this bag, which "appears"  durable. The bag comes with the handle as shown and a larger over the shoulder clip on belt. As always, my order was carefully packaged and arrived on time.
I love this bag because it is durable, attractive, roomy yet compact and it's uses are limited only by one's imagination. This is an quality item and a great value.  I would purchase it again, and I do recommend for other shoppers.

reviewText:
This toiletry bag is very convenient and holds alot considering it's size. There are plenty of pockets for space, I am able to hold everything from cologne to dental floss. The bag is tall enough to hold cologne or a regular size Gillette shaving gel. The handle is pretty strong and nice zippered/mesh pockes to hold smaller items.  The only downside of the bag is that there are no "plastic sealed" pockets to hold items that might be moist etc..., Otherwise the carry bag is pretty handy.  I would consider getting a companion bag if necessary to hold larger items like cologne or shampoo. I would still recommend this bag for a cheap yet quality toiletry bag.

reviewText: washed once and faded only in spots..not all over...

I love pajama jeans. I bought my first pair on sale at walmart about 5 years ago and since then I've literally never bought another pair of regular jeans. People think of them as the crocs of pants, but screw that! Nobody can ever tell I'm wearing "pajamas." They look exactly like regular jeans, only they're more flattering because they don't cause muffin top. They're more comfortable, although I've never really felt compelled to try to sleep in them. To me they still are firmly in the "pant" category.

I bought this black pair To wear to my retail job and they've worked perfectly and are lasting just as well as my regular denim pajama jeans. The only issue I've found with these is the size difference in the petite pants. I'm usually an XL which is usually for around a size 18-20. They do come pretty snug on me (as I'm closer to a size 20) but they usually loosen up toward the end of the day or the second day. These were the right length for my short legs, but they were also a little bit tighter than I was used to. I think that's probably normal for petite items, but it was kind of frustrating for me, especially since they didn't have a 1x in petite.

We ended up purchasing another one in a 1x so I can wear that size while I'm losing weight.
summary: A little smaller than I expected (but still Pajama Jeans, so still awesome.)

reviewText: i liked the pants but had to exchange for 1 size larger, this particular pair ran smaller.

These fit as expected because I was forewarned that they run small and do not stretch at the waist.  In fact, for a woman 5' 8", 120 lbs the size "Medium" are perfect.  Now, that should be a warning for anybody who is at the large end of the "Medium" spectrum. You may need to go with "Large".  I could wish the legs were 1/2" longer, but I may just let down the hem.  Or not--after all, I got them to wear with boots!

The fabric, I should mention, is not really corduroy, which one thinks of as a ribbed low-nap fabric.  There are no ribs, although there is a soft nap.  I feel like I'm wearing faux suede.  The fabric has a gentle stretch to it, and returns nicely to the shape of my legs when I straighten my knees.

The stitching does not stretch, and the waist is stitching-intensive, so getting into them is always a bit of a squeeze until they're past my hip bones.  Then they are just plain perfect.

The color is as depicted, a beautiful dark teal.
Love them. They fit as expected and I look positively darling in them.  Ordered 8-10 and the teal is rich and lovely.  I would buy again... perhaps red or...

reviewText:
I've owned several different versions of stretch comfy jeans over the years, decided to try these and waited to review them until I'd had a chance to wear them around a bit.

They are definitely comfy.  Biggest issue is the waistline/ drawstring and my personal jury is still somewhat out on that.  My waist measurement is only about 5 inches less than hips so I first tried using these without tying the drawstring, had to keep pulling them up each time I rose.  With the drawstring tied somewhat loosely they do tend to stay up yet I don't actually have to untie them to pull them down, so I'm pleased with that.  I guess the issue is drawstring versus all elastic.  Since Ive had both styles, or rather elastic in back, I must say that the drawstring seems to work a bit better than elastic in terms of keep the pants from sliding down while remaining comfy.  I think a combination of button and elastic might be the best but so far I've not had any like that.

While these look like denim they aren't very rugged, so not ideal for work/ garden.  I've had comfort jeans that were more suitable for rugged activities.  These are better suited to lounging or everyday stuff.  But I doubt you'd find anything more rugged with similar comfort in this price range  a pretty good value.

I'm 5'4 with long torso, shorter legs, so always need Petite size pants  length on these is perfect for me.

Given those caveats, I'm happy with my purchase.
summary: Definitely comfy once drawstring is adjusted right; not very rugged, as "Pajama" suggests

reviewText: I like these jeans, they re so comfortable

I initially bought these in regular and they were far too long so I was happy to see a petite length. I'm 5'5 and they're perfect. As others have said, the waist isn't really stretchy but after wearing them, the band stretched a little, so the snug fit decreases somewhat throughout the day. I don't really use the drawstring and they stay up just fine. The rest of the "jeans" stretches a ton so they do give a little more than I'd like by the time the day is over, but I don't find them to stretch out to the point where they're unflattering. These are, by far, the most comfortable pair of pants I own and can easily be dressed up or down in the dark wash. They're great for feeling like you're wearing a yoga pant but not looking like you're wearing activewear when running errands or out and about. I would definitely purchase them again!

reviewText: I have two pair that I have worn for almost a year.  They are finally wearing out in places so I ordered two new pair.  To make sure that I got the exact same pair I went to my past orders and clicked on the link.  The ones I just received are several inches smaller than the ones I have been wearing.  I checked the tags in the old and new pairs and they claim to be the same size.  Why change something so vital as size on clothing that is ordered online? I will have to return these and I am not sure that I am willing to order two new pair for the hassle or just go get two pair of cheaper regular jeans that at least I can try on first.  Also, way to give a bigger girl a heart attack by drastically reducing the waist while keeping the same tag size.  If I didn't have two pair to compare them to I would have been seriously freaked out about the apparent weight gain.
summary: Not the same size as before

They do seem to have faded some and are no longer a crisp dark black like they were when they were new. I do see some "softness" coming out with little fuzzies but not actual balls of cloth that some complained of when they put them in the dryer. I'm 5'2", 240 lbs & bought size 2x petite. They fit perfect in both length & width but do stretch out a bit with wear, shrinking back to size after laundering. They are very soft & comfortable. I needed something comfortable & warm to wear on a 5 hour airline flight & these worked perfectly. I also wear them to work on jeans-day & no one can tell there're not true demin. Also, the "boot" leg seems to be more of a bell-bottom. Certainly wider than the average boot-leg style but I don't find that to be a problem.

I thought they would be a bit of a joke but they are some of my favorite jeans. My neighbor complimented me on them and was blown away that they were PajamaJeans lol. I have to say, the one thing I noticed is how much everyone else likes them. I have never received as many compliments as I have for these for anything else. In my life. Seriously, I even got married and I looked like a princess and still I've gotten more positive feedback on these R2-D2 earrings!

reviewText:

The touch screen tips do work and they work well, they are just a little bulky to type with, even on my iPhone 6 Plus. Depending on the phone you have, they might be too cumbersome to use without hitting the wrong keys when you're typing because your fingers with look like and feel like you're typing with little Vienna Sausages.

I'm pretty happy with these gloves and I like that I have them as an option when I need to be out in the cold and I don't have to use my phone much, such as when I take my dog for walks.

And to pick it up I need to remove my warm and cozy glow, even for a second, and then I put it on again - and we continue our walk.  But... Why not to share the news?  I take an iPhone from the pocket and now do not need to remove a glove, I can easily start it and press the call button and share the great news to everyone who wants to listen : ).  OK, it's a joke.  The gloves are perfect.  They are warm, cozy, light, easy to carry in the pocket (not too bulky) and have a pleasant color.  My favorite is grey color, but I bought them in different colors and gave as a present.  Everyone loves them.  I hope ELMA will stay in business for long time - we all need good quality gloves.

The BEST compliment was, of course, from my husband who stated, "Wow! WOW! You look so beautiful! I love the way that poncho looks on you!" I couldn't be happier. As well, this is a small company- which I didn't realize until Friday night when I read their email. I was so touched by the email to follow-up as well as the customer service. They seem to really care about putting out a good quality product as well as pleasing their customers and this speaks to me.

I will absolutely be looking for more from this company as I couldn't be happier. I had purchased 2-other ponchos in the past and neither of them were of the quality that this one is nor the price. As well, the varied lines on this poncho make it fun to wear. Yes, FuN!

Great outdoors/hiking/duty watch. Great bulid quality, especially given the price.

I didn't want to spend Luminox- or Victorinox-like money. For me, this was a solid alternative, especially with its mineral glass face (I'm very happy about that ... at this price one usually only finds polycarbonate, not glass).

I only have three cons, although nothing major. 1) Wrist band is too long (I'm not a small guy and I'm using the second-from-closest notch to the watch case); 2) Unnecessarily hefty weight; and 3) LCD/backlit display is cheap ... older technology and easily distorted if you press in the display buttons with a solid effort.

Keeps great time, looks hardcore, and it looks/feels extremely rugged and expensive.

Would I buy from this company again? Absolutely. Love it.
summary: Can't Beat It for the Money. Excellent Watch.

reviewText: I usually wear a size 2, but sized up to a medium as it said that would be a size 4 so they wouldn't be too tight as other reviews mentioned.  Well the fit is good, but the length is a little short.  Luckily I don't mind a shorter look for pants, jeans and leggings, especially in this style, so they work for me.  I do understand now about what another reviewer mentioned about the crotch being too small.  They were kinda awkward to move around in when I first put them on, but after holding onto the waist band and doing lots of squats and kicking out to the sides looking like a maniac, everything was stretched in the crotch area and way more comfortable.  As for the slits in the leggings, hey are super cute and they look great on.  I tried them with my converse and with heels and they look great both ways, so the versatility is great too.  Other than the length and the odd crotch fit, they are awesome and both of those things were remedied easily for me and for the price, you can't really except them to be perfect.  Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and feel comfortable recommending this to others.  As a person who buys almost everything on Amazon, it is important that reviewers leave honest feedback so as fellow consumers we know how to make more informed decisions as to how to spend our hard earned money. I did receive a discount in exchange for my honest review which is what you have just read.

reviewText: This outfit is okay. Outfit came with 3 fishnet stockings (lol), they were white, not red. My biggest complaint is the top isn't like it is in the picture. It also seems to be a large, so it doesn't fit me (I'm 5'5" around 110lbs, so on the skinny side). The skirt seems to be a small maybe even an x-small, it fits me and I'm mostly happy with the skirt. The emblem on the skirt isn't on the front, it's on the side, almost at the middle of my hip and you can clearly see the stitching line in the front of the skirt as the pattern wasn't matched up and from what I could read it says "Ertsh Colege" lol. Tie and collar are fine, though collar fabric is flimsy so it doesn't stand up like in photo, tie does say "Police" or "POUCE", my husband pointed out lol. The G-string isn't wearable really either, it has too much in the crotch area so the fabric puffs out and it's awkward feeling when wearing it. Overall, it's good for the price, only thing I can't wear is the top.

my 3 y/o loves these dresses... I quickly had to learn that when ordering clothing/ dresses from China, you need to order 2 sizes bigger than child usually wears. (example my 3 y/o wears around a 3t in American clothing, although most of the time I will buy size 4t for growing space) when I order her dresses from China I will order usually a 5/6, now that fits like a 3t if you want it bigger for growing space order the size up. now don't get me wrong the dresses are not skin tight on her, they fit perfect with some room. Now the dress itself... the top half of the dress is made of a Super soft material, thin like a T-shirt and extremely comfortable. the bottom twils for her, which she loves. Unfortunently the bow unravels rather easy, but the ribbon is not at all what makes the dress awesome. Also the dress is easy to put on for the little ones who are learning to dress themselves
summary: China's sizes are roughly 2 sizes smaller than American sizes,

reviewText:
I bought this as part of my halloween costume for this year. Very disappointed in the product. Straight out of the bag, 3 feathers came off (even though I was exceptionally carefully taking it out of the bag). As I was trying on my outfit, being even more gentle than I was another 4 feathers came off. I haven't even left my house and I'm already down 7 feathers. I'm going to try to hot glue them back onto the skirt.

If it wasn't so close to halloween and me being lazy and not wanting to shop around for another feather skirt, I'd return this. I can't believe this was $25 and the quality is no where near close.

I'll upload pictures of this sad situation.

This skirt isn't exactly as pictured. You can see in the image that there's a thin band of non-feathered black fabric at the top, just the below the elastic waistband, and I was expecting that. Numerous reviews commented on that and few said they covered it up with a belt. However, when I tried on the skirt, the non-feathered portion was several inches, and combined with the elastic waistband, much too large to cover with even a wide belt. It looked quite odd and I couldn't figure out why the feathers didn't just go all the way to the waistband. It was impossible to ear with a shirt tucked in or a cropped shirt. I tried it on with a shirt on the outside, and then it looked okay, but not the look I was going for. Wanted to wear it for a bird costume on Halloween, and a loose untucked shirt isn't exactly sexy. I ended up returning it.

The feathers are of nice quality, color, and shine, and match the black-green iridescent look pictured. I did not think the skirt was too short, but it is definitely a mini-skirt.

Re Size: I ordered an XL based on customer reviews, and it fit correctly (a little big int he stomach area, a little tight in the thighs, as most of my clothing fits. I typically wear a size 10-12 and would have probably ordered a large in a miniskirt had I not read the reviews.
Got the wrong item

reviewText: Beautiful skirt - if you are on the fence, order it! The only thing that I don't like is that the top row does not have a "finished" look to it. I ordered this skirt for a raven costume to accompany an Edgar Allan Poe costume. It worked really well aside from me having to order a couple different skirts to get the size right. The reviews I read said it ran small so I ordered a medium AND a large, just in case. (I am 5'3", about 130 lb with small hips). I ended up sending those two back and buying a small. Wore it to a costume party. A few feathers fell off but you couldn't tell where they came off. I also wore a belt at the top of the skirt because the waistband doesn't have feathers. You could also fold the waistband in to have only the feathered part displayed as long as you aren't tall (then your bum might be showing!). Overall I would recommend.

I'm going to start by saying that based on the ring itself, and very cute packaging, this WOULD have been a five star rating if they had ONLY been less... misleading. This is a gorgeous piece of costume jewelry and the amount of labor required to cast and plate the body (yes- PLATE- I will get to that), and cut and set the stones, is worth quite a bit more than twenty bucks.

"Topaz simulated diamond 10k gold filled" with a picture of a blue center stone. Any reasonable person will take that to mean that blue stone is topaz, the side stones are CZ or equivalent, and the body is solid low-karat white gold.
The center stone MAY in fact be topaz; I am not qualified to call that one, but it certainly isn't the color shown in the pictures. It is very nicely cut for a piece in this price range, and shows some color refraction in daylight.
The side stones are for the most part perfectly acceptable, but two that are set in the crown actually have a golden color that once I noticed it, I see at a glance. Again... TWENTY BUCKS. I'm not heartbroken.
Here's why I'm so annoyed. Why can't some Amazon sellers just be honest and say exactly what it is we are buying?
The ad makes it sound like solid cheap white gold. It has a stamp inside the band that says "10K" very clearly. A stamp like that should never, but often does, appear on items with a base metal center. The seller responded to a question by saying 'it's white copper', which is commonly referred to as cupronickel, It's an ideal material for coins and silverware and certainly finds its way into plenty of costume jewellery. That would have been a reasonable material to make a ring like this out of.
I did a quick test on the inside of the ring using a drop of high concentration Nitric acid. If the material were cupronickel, it would have fizzed and turned greenish blue. NOTHING. Well color me surprised, this ring is in fact gold plated.
I scratched through the plating on the inside, having by now decided not to return it because it's so nice looking, and the center is also not 'white copper'. It's plain red copper. A nitric acid test fizzed up and the second picture is of the blue color on a lab wipe. They could have used cupronickel inside, which would have been better as the plating wore off so as not to be so obvious.
NEVER wear this ring to the beach or in any environment where it will be exposed to abrasives.
My last complaint is that I attempted to cancel my order 20 minutes after placing it, and got a message TWO DAYS LATER that it was being shipped. Really?!

Okay now for the good stuff. I ordered this ring to wear with my stainless Invicta watch and the styles complement each other well. The ring is bright and looks and feels much more solid than your average costume jewellery. It IS extremely well put together, even if the material description is questionable. I have a stainless steel ring on order to wear to work, since this one DEFINITELY won't last long at a machine shop, but it will be a fabulous weekend ring.
summary: Five stars for beautiful product turn into two stars for misleading description!!!!

Ive been searching for high waisted pants that actually have a high enough rise to sit at my waist for a long time. I have a long torso so most pants fit much lower on me than they should and when I try on high waisted pants then tend to sit an inch or two below my belly button and not actually at my waist.  I am 58 and 145. I usually wear a 29 or an 8 so at first I ordered a medium and it was very big on me. I sent back the medium and ordered a small and they are perfect!  They are high enough that they sit right at my waist and they are still long enough that they stop just above the floor when Im wearing flats.  They are made of an excellent quality fabric and although it says it can be hand washed, dry clean them or youll be sorry as even hand washing in ice water will shrink the hell out of them and make the fabric stiff. Ive learned this the hard way with this fabric but it is the same kind of fabric youll find shopping at Nordstrom and Anthropologie.  Id also like to note that the customer service provided by the company who makes these pants, Poshsquare, is absolutely above and beyond exceptional. If you have any problems at all with them (I had a small defect in the fabric where a white thread was woven in with them which they took care of for me with no problems) just contact them and they are very willing to help you out.

reviewText:
The Minowl Minimalist RFID blocking Men's wallet and money clip came packaged in a very nice, sturdy black box very suitable for gifting.  My first impression was this wallet/money clip was made with quality materials.  You could both see and feel it, and it is no wonder since each wallet is handcrafted with top grade fine calfskin leather. I really love the slim, lightweight, sleek look of this wallet and the fact that the magnet works to hold your cash in place. I honestly would only say 5-7 bills tops to be safe definitely not 18 as described, the magnet was not able to hold all that securely. It has two slots for cards, one is clear for say a drivers license. It is suitable for up to 4 cards. A con is that the magnet is somewhat worrisome with its potential affect on the credit cards.
It is nice when you do not want to carry a big wallet just something to bring your drivers license, ATM/debit card, health insurance cards and some cash.  It is very slim and can fit in either your front or back pocket with no bulkiness as it is only 0.43" The great  feature is obviously the RFID Blocking technology which securely protects yours your cards and identity.  This is a nice added piece of mind.  While we know nothing is 100% everything is worth the chance to reduce the risk associated with high tech pick-pocketers.

All in all this is a very nice money clip/wallet,well made and very nice looking.  However, it cannot hold much and I am not so sure about the magnet with the cards.  I received this product at a discounted rate for my unbiased review.

The Minowl Minimalist RFID blocking Men's wallet and money clip is just the right size for today's simple guy. Those that carry just a little spare cash and only the basic day to day necessities; drivers license, banking/atm/debit card, health insurance card, maybe 1-2 credit cards or store savings cards.

The clip itself is magnetic to hold the cash in place, it can probably hold maybe 10 bills before the magnet won't be strong enough to hold. I don't see that being a problem for my husband, but it's worth noting.

The best feature is obviously the RFID Blocking technology which securely protects yours your cards and identity. While nothing is foolproof, and you could still be targeted by those things that attach to gas pumps (always pay inside!), this goes a long way in helping to protect your identity from being stolen. It only takes 2 seconds and before you get home from the grocery store your account will be dry.

As a mother, grandmother and business owner, I know and understand the true value of an honest review, I, myself, depend on reviews when making purchases and my business only exists thanks to testimonies and reviews from clients. I personally guarantee a fully unbiased review of this product.

DISCLAIMER: I received this item at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, I am in no way connected or related to the seller.
summary: Money clip, minimal style wallet with RFID Blocking technology, perfect for the simple style man in your life!

reviewText: Arrived when promised packaged looked and performed as advertised

I received a free sample of this product for testing and review.

The wallet looks great, but I remain skeptical about the staying power of the magnet on the clip side of the wallet. I also worry about its implications for the magnetic strips in credit cards. These are just hunches, not founded on any real experience (my cards still worked after a day of use and they never fell out of my wallet), but I think there are better options available on Amazon.

summary: The clip doesn't hold more than one credit card. ...

reviewText: The money clip won't hold any money so it is useless.  I am going to return it and will probably get stuck with paying shipping. A total waste.

I really wanted to like this little, minimalist money-clip/wallet hybrid more, but one fatal flaw -- THE USE OF THE MAGNET -- makes truly falling in love with this item impossible. First the good stuff: it's small, sturdy, well made, and pretty elegant. I simply love the idea of using a slim little wallet like this for a credit card, an ID, and some cash. Most of the time, I feel like that's all I really need with me. But the problems are with the use of the magnet. It's both too weak to effectively hold much cash, and I'm not at all crazy about the idea of putting a magnet near my credit cards. In fact, this wallet seems like a good way to lose money: if your cash doesn't fall off while using the magnet clip, the magnet will wipe out your credit cards. So that is a problem from my perspective. With all that said, I've chosen 3 stars because "it's okay." Yes, this is an okay little clip/wallet hybrid that certainly can come in handy for days when 1) I only have a small amount of cash, like 2 bills on me, and 2) I'm not carrying a credit card. I received this item as a free sample. What you've seen and read here is my honest and unbiased opinion.
summary: Nice and Small, But Magnet is a Real Problem

I received all three products from this company...the pouch (which hangs around the neck), the belt that wears around the waist, and this money clip.  I figured I would group these together as they were reviewed together and I have the same story to tell!  LOL!  To quote the pouch review..."This pouch is technically made for traveling. But do you know where I got MY credit card information stolen from? (Of course you don't...that's why I am going to tell you). :) At a concert! At the Palace of Auburn Hills...where the Detroit Pistons play! Someone STOLE my info and signed me up for THREE online dating sites! When hubby got a call from the bank, he obviously had a fit thinking I was cheating on him! YIKES! LOL Anyway, after doing some research and calling the bank etc, I was able to contact the 3 online dating services and I tried to get the info of the person who had used MY name and card. THIS is what I got from them all: "I'm sorry. We cannot give out that personal information!" I said "They STOLE my identification and used my credit card illegally!" "Sorry, ma'am, there is nothing we can do but cancel this account and refund your money". WOW!!!!! Can you believe that? Protecting the thieves' privacy. Interesting. Needless to say, I no longer go to any concerts, amusement parks, large venues etc, without something like this. This is perfect for any types of trips and the multiple zippers will stop at least the very basic pick pocket. If somebody is THAT good, they will find a way to get to you no matter what. (Did you ever see Mission Impossible? NOTHING surprises me now). HA! But I digress..."
This money clip came in a nice gift box, with a formed, velvet insert protecting it.  The magnet is very strong and clasps nicely.  My son just turned 12, and for his birthday everybody gave him money and gift cards.  Usually they lay all over the floor of his room, so this was perfect for him.  And because it is a magnet, it will keep him occupied for hours!  HA....OK....maybe a slight exaggeration, but seriously, the kid loves to play with magnets!  LOL
The new credit cards have a small chip in them that stores your personal information . These RDIF protectors etc are designed to block the average thief with a scanner/decoder that can be hidden in a coat, purse, bag etc. This gives you great peace of mind AND it is 100% money back guaranteed. So, besides your personal information...what do you have to lose? LOL

DISCLAIMER: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review. I will update if I find any major issues with this, and will also see how this withstands the beating of a 12 year old!  HA!
summary: Nice strong magnet with RFID block!

I purchased this to wear over a cami since I loathe hot weather but hate having bare arms. I bought it in a size Large so I'd have some breathing room and I'd have that lose, breezy look. This did not disappoint in the slightest! I would have fit well in a Medium but I think the point of this top is to give you a more casual, relaxed, boho look and if you're looking for that, I'd recommend ordering one size up. There's a lot of shoulder room, the material is great quality chiffon (with no visible flaws or loose threads), it isn't stiff, and was wrinkle-free right out of the package. I love this and I've already worn it twice since I received it less than a week ago, this is definitely going to be a summer staple for me! My only complaint is that there aren't more styles to choose from, because I'd honestly buy one in every color.

Buy it, I can guarantee you won't have an iota of regret. :-)

reviewText: This is an adorable Panda Romper. It is so soft and plush. I wouldn't consider the material of this flannel as the title states, it's definitely plush and feels like the soft fur on a stuffed animal. The hood is the Panda's face which is so cute. The face has actual plastic eyes but they are attached very well. The suit itself has a full length zipper down the front and it continues to the backside just a few inches. The zipper is really nice because it is a 2 way zipper so you can zip and unzip from the top or the bottom. The foot part is not covered which again, I really like so it's easier to leave shoes on with this. The backside even has a cute little panda tail. I got this for a friend of mine for her to use for Halloween for her little one and to use when it's the Fall season here. The zipper moved freely going both ways and had no sticking or separating. Overall, this is adorable and well worth the cost ($13.99 at the time of review). It's well made and none of the plush comes off. I would recommend this. I received this product with a promotional discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. No compensation for a positive review was provided. All of my reviews are based 100% off of my experience with the product and I never guarantee a positive review.

reviewText: I bought this for my 2 year old and it fits my husband.
Great boxer! Perfect fit!

My kids are getting older and specifically requested no more regular brief style underwear. I bought them a large pack of boxer briefs but they said they didn't like them because try felt funny on. One I realized that all of the material was synthetic, I wanted to try a mostly cotton blend fabric. I found these and really liked the simple colors with no design, the sizes were perfect, and they are 95% cotton.

I received these very quickly after ordering. They come in a soft plastic package with snap closure, I washed all of them immediately and put them in my kids underwear drawer for them. They reported back to me that they are very comfortable and don't feel strange like the other pair. They didn't dig into their sides or leave indents like a lot of underwear can. They already requested that I get rid of all the other ones and buy a couple more packages of these. And at this price, I can easily do that. These don't have an opening in the front so kids can use it to go to the bathroom but my kids said they don't like using the restroom like that anyway, so it doesn't affect us at all.

These are a great deal and I would recommend for any parents to buy their young kids. They are well made and constructed, high quality materials, comfortable, and very high cotton content, just as we needed and wanted.

I received this product at a discounted price for my honest review.

reviewText: The size of the waist band is disproportionately large compared to the leg openings.

I bought these boxer briefs for my son. He's  kinda picky with his underwear and likes a nice snug fit that does not ride up or bunch up underneath his pants. He has sensory issues so it is important that there are no tags hanging out (even when I cut them, he can still tell as you never really are able to get all of the tag out) and he easily gets irritated by the itchy plastic.  These briefs do have a tag, but it is located along the side seam, not in the back. I removed it simply by tearing it out and it really did come out very well.

The material is very soft and waistband is nice and thick, giving it that sturdy feeling. The colors are nice and clean and did not fade in the wash.

The only downsides to this product are the skrinkage and the length of the legs. They did skrink a bit in the first washing, even though I washed them on the cold water setting. I would say that they are almost, but not quite, a full size smaller than the size I purchased. My son is 10, so I purchased the 9-11 size. They still fit him the way he likes, but they he will grow out of them faster because of the shrinkage...though the material is such a good quality that the construction of the garment will far outlive the amount of time he will be in them! (Good thing he has a younger brother!) Second, the length of the legs...in the vendor picture, the legs look like they will go down a couple, if not a few, inches on the thighs. Before washing these boxer briefs, I noticed that the legs looked a bit shorter than anticipated. After washing them, they are even shorter. They will still work fine, but if you are looking for a longer length, these will shrink in the wash...even if you purchase a size up.

But overall, these briefs are well-made with quality materials. I do recommend them.

I received this product for a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. Would I purchase these again? Yes. I would.
summary: Comfortable fit, solid construction, and quality materials make these boxer briefs a very good purchase

reviewText:
It was a little confusing when reading about the description of these sunglasses. Description says "made in USA" and if you know a thing or two about Ray-Ban, they're Italian made...then I contacted a representative and they told me they come from Seattle (maybe that's what they meant by "made in USA"?), but they could be shipped from China and the probability of them being fake was high or if they're shipped from Seattle, Washington, they'd be the real deal.

I don't understand how a company can have their product shipped from two locations - some product genuine and some product not.

The reviews on Amazon are totally mixed and random. Many people got fake sunglasses and many people got real ones. I decided to take the risk and worst case scenario, I'd get my money back in the event they were not real Ray-Bans.

Mine just arrived today! So my review is very much fresh and new. I own 2 pairs of Ray-Bans (sunglasses and eyeglasses) so I knew to check:
1. The box for the "made Italy" (Milano/Milan)
2. Check the top left lenses for the engraving of the RB logo
3. Make sure the shades don't come in a plastic bag but rather the frames (the part that goes behind the ear) are protected by a plastic cover
4. The case has to be authentic and have the Ray-Ban stamp

Mine had all of these details and I am pleased with my purchase of well-priced, lightweight, authentic, Italian made, summer ready, Ray-Bans.

With every purchase on Amazon its better to double check with the seller where in fact the item is coming from, ask about the authenticity, and other concerns that may arise.

I hope this review was helpful and substantial!

reviewText: I was so excited to find dinosaur Jammies in purple and pink!

These pajamas are both cute and well fitted! My daughter wears them at least once a week and after two months of regular wear, they are holding up very well! The material is a thin fleece, which is warm but breathable! My daughter is 50th percentile (exactly average for her age) and these pajamas fit her comfortably.

I love this sleeper and I LOVE that it's a purple dinosaur pattern! It's so hard to find dinosaur patterns "for girls." Nice quality fleece, but it seems to run big. I have a lot of the Leveret sleepers (not fleece) and this one is much bigger. But I love it! Very soft fleece and no pilling so far.
I returned these as they were weirdly shaped - the crotch came way too low and the legs were way too short.  Too bad, as the print was cute.

Bought this as a shower gift for my friend - the material is very soft and I love the dinosaur print (so hard to find dinosaur stuff for girls!). My only complaint is that it seemed to be a little on the small side for a 6-12 month size compared to other footed sleepers that I have in the same size. Material was substantial though -- will be great for cold nights!
It's adorable! You don't see many dinosaur clothes for girls. It's very soft and fits pretty well.

Legs on this sleeper are really short (the rest of the dimensions are okay for my 7.5 month old). So if your baby is a backup dancer for MC Hammer, this is the one for you; otherwise, you might want to pass.

Hands down my all time favorite phone case! Designer look without the pain of a designer price tag! I receive COUNTLESS compliments on this case which only makes me love it a little more each time! haha
Mine came quicker than I expected and in perfect condition with a clean and vibrant design. It has also stood up to the test of time so far! there is no visible wear or tear on the design which I was worried would fade quickly. From time to time I just give it a quick wipe down with a wet paper towel and it removes most dirt and little stains from daily use.. for the tougher spots I just add a little soap and viola! like new again! Its durability even goes beyond just the design, this case can take a hit! I've dropped my phone inside this case more times than I would like to admit.. it does do a great job of absorbing the shock and keeping my phone safe! It even has raised edges that keeps my screen safe as well! The only cons, which I hardly even consider, are the cutout spots for the camera, charging port and headphone jack. You can't really take a picture with the flash while this case is on. The case itself does not obstruct the view in any way on either camera but if you use the flash on the back camera the photo won't come out properly. As for the charging port and headphone jack you just have to, for lack of a better term, squish it in there.. they do fit and stay put, just needs a little extra help getting there. Other people have stated and asked about the size of the case being an issue but it doesn't bother me at all! in fact if you are anything like me if you don't have your phone in hand its probably lost at the bottom of some never ending purse or backpack.. this case makes my phone so much easier to find through all the clutter! It even fits into SOME of my jean pockets!
summary: You can't beat the price! Love this case!!

reviewText:
This garment fits me as depicted, however I am not quite 5'3" tall. I did measure it, to double check against what was provided on the page, and found it to be generally accurate. I will say that in order for these measurements to be true, the sleeves must be measured from the center back, right where the label is, and the length measured at the highest point on the shoulder, close to the neck. The width is there also, but the garment is not designed to come together in the center front. If you lay it flat the front panels are separated by a gap of roughly 6 inches.
  For many people this is going to be too small to fit as shown, however it may work equally well as a bolero. Since there is just the one size, I hoped it might be helpful if I posted my experience.

While the color and stitching is great, it doesn't fit like the picture at all. The sleeves come just past the elbow and the back falls at your lower back. It is much more fitted than what is depicted.

reviewText: I LOVE these earrings!! I get compliments on them every time I wear them!
Very nice.

These are my first pair of ear climbers.  I'm very picky about earrings.  They have to be easy to put in, comfortable to wear, & not gaudy.  I normally wear plain, white gold hoops, but it's nice to have a change once in awhile.  I'm also a little avant-garde with my jewelry, so the idea of ear climbers appeals to me.  I've been looking for something simple & clean that I can wear every day.  I've seen a few pair that were interesting, but not quite right.  Then I saw these.  They were perfect!  Just a simple sweep of silver that follows the contour of the ear.  Subtle, & almost art deco.  I was worried about how easy it would be to put in the ear pins , & whether the climbers would stay put, but other reviewers who had had the same concerns did not encounter any problems.  I also appreciated that I would be purchasing directly from the artist who makes them.  I ordered these & also a pair of serpentine climbers to wear for a special occasion coming up.  I prefer while metal, & it was nice that I could order both pairs in sterling silver.  Since they were coming from Greece, I figured it would take several weeks for them to get here.
That evening, I found a personal e-mail from Emmanuela, thanking me for the order, & giving me a time frame for shipment.  She sent the climbers FedEx, & they came from Greece to California in 2 days!  I opened the envelope to find them gift boxed with bows & gift bags included (although I bought them for myself, it's a lovely extra).  Each pair of climbers is in a small (probably anti-tarnish) bag, & there are plastic stoppers to keep them in place on your ears.
And they are as lovely as their pictures; in the case of the sweeps, even more so.  In the picture, it looks like the sweep is textured all along its length.  Actually, it's smooth for about 2/3rds of it's length, & only the top part is textured.  This adds to its art deco feel.  The serpentine climbers are very dramatic, just right for the party I intend to wear them to (with my LBD, of course!).
I ran to the mirror & took about 5 minutes to figure out how to get the climbers to work.  You bend the pin outward & put it through your piercing, like you would an ear hook (so it's hanging upside down).  Put the stopper on the pin, & swing the whole thing around so that it slides over the side of the ear.  The pin runs up the underside of the ear.  I put mine right up against the spot where the ear joins the neck.  Then pinch the pin closed from the bottom up.  The climber stays put & I don't even notice it's there.  Oh, by the way, I wear glasses.  The climbers don't interfere at all (I was wearing my glasses when I put the climbers in).
Altogether, this has been one of my best buying experiences on Amazon.  I'm impressed by Emmanuela, her attention to her customers, & her product.  I will buy from her again.

reviewText: Should have listened to other posts saying these weren't the 'real deal' they are knock off genie bras - and the also do not have the same pads, they are much thinner and slightly misshapen.  The other big detractor for me, is that they only have the insert for the pads at the top portion (near the straps) instead of on the side like the original GB's have for replacing the padded liners, after washing - the side panels are sewn shut & I don't want to run the risk of tearing them should I try and remove the stitching.  The product itself is stretchy enough, but the material is definitely thinner than the originals, so you do not get the same structure, or support than you would with the name brand version. If you don't mind a knock off for the price, then by all means order these as they won't disappoint, but I am not thrilled and wish I would have just bought them in the store and gotten what I wanted vs. getting what I was hoping would be as good a product as the original but for a slightly less price.  Wound up spending more on bras then I originally planned as I had to buy a 2 pack in store this past weekend, on top of keeping these.
summary: NOT the real deal - Knock offs

Just wanted to provide some clarification about the sizing. I never order clothing from amazon but decided to give this a go since I was looking for a vest and having a lot of trouble searching within stores. Just to get it out there first, the vest is fantastic. I got it in the "red" which is really just a pretty maroon color. Very comfy as well.  I haven't worn it out yet and I live in SoCal so I can't attest to how warm it will keep you.

With sizing though. I'm 5'6 and about 135 lbs. I'm a size 6 in bottoms (size 6 hips) and a size 4/6 in tops with a small bust. I generally wear a size medium in teen stores (ie Forever 21) and a small in women's clothing. I was planning on going with my normal small but decided to go with a medium after reading all the reviews (its an asian brand so the sizing is smaller, if you're between sizes size up, etc.). I wish I had gone with my typical size and instinct because I received the medium and it was too large for my liking. I'm currently wearing a long sleeve shirt and a sweatshirt and there's still some space. It's not that it runs large, its just that it runs like normal clothing I purchase. If you're a pretty consistent size, I'd recommend sticking with it and not sizing up. I'm thinking about purchasing another one in a small and giving the medium to my mother. Hope this review helped!

*sidenote: The pockets were just fine! (another comment left by a lot of reviewers that the pockets were too small). I suppose I have petite hands but I was still able to fit my iphone 6 and hands in at the same time. Maybe I just got lucky or maybe the company started making changes!

This ring is cute but kind of uncomfortable. Im a cat lover so I enjoy having cat accessories, and this is a very cute one. I like the way the ring looks with the little ears poking up. The ring is slightly wider than I was expecting so it looks a little less delicate than I thought it would, but thats not really a problem. The cat paws on the back are a cute detail, but I actually think the toes look a little weird. Its like they are too long so they almost look like fingers instead of kitty. The foot pads on the inside of the ring band are really sweet too, but seems unnecessary since it is never visible when you're wearing the ring. The ring seems pretty sturdy - even though it is adjustable it holds its shape well. And its great that its adjustable, since it didn't fit any of my fingers when I had the paws pinched together (which is how it came). It was too big for my pinky finger, but too small for all my other fingers. When I stretch the paws a few millimeters apart I can fit it on my ring finger, and sometimes I like to wear it on my middle finger next to my wedding bands. However, when the paws are stretched apart it kind of pinches my skin between them, making it a little uncomfortable to wear. The edges of the paws are a little rough so it kind of scrapes me when my skin touches the edges. It catches on my finger any time the ring turns at all, and if I make the ring tight enough that it doesnt turn it is uncomfortable on my finger and pinches. It is not uncomfortable enough that Ill never use the ring. I just wish it was a little easier to wear so I could wear it more often.

reviewText:
I love that this ring has a secret surprise on the inside!  Ugghhh.....it's SO CUTE with those little paws.  It's ridiculously cute.  Ears and paws...........honestly, how does it get any better than this if you're an animal lover?

I can definitely confirm that it's stamped 925 for sterling silver, which is nice.  I've bought a lot of jewelry on Amazon over the years, and I've found that most of the time, plating wears off almost immediately, so it's often worth it to spring for sterling if you want to wear the piece every day without worry.  Obviously, though---it's not the sturdiest ring.  This isn't heavy-duty silver.  SO you can absolutely damage it and bend it out of shape just by innocently doing normal things, like holding a handrail.  I almost ruined a thin silver ring just by gripping my steering wheel too tightly.......I looked at my hand and saw that the bottom of the ring had been compressed flat!  So be careful with this ring if you want to keep it in good condition.  If you grip something super-tight, you'll bend it.

For now, mine is in good shape. I accepted a sale price on this ring in exchange for a candid review, but my mother and sister love animals as much as I do, so I'm planning ahead for Christmas stocking stuffers.  This is an affordable and endearing way to show off your love for cats, and the hidden paws kill me every time I look at them.  Help me, I'm dead from too much cute.
Really cute  very happy with the ring.

This ring is super cute.  I ordered it for my daughter who loves cats.  It is pretty small, and fits on her pinky finger.  However, you can adjust it by pulling on it a little bit.  I like buying good quality jewelry, so I was sure to make sure this is sterling silver, which it is.  This came shipped in a cute jewelry box.  When the box is opened, you find this cute ring inside a clear bag.  The ring is really impressive and adorable in person.  I realize the ring is adjustable, but it seems pretty small.  This would probably work better for people with smaller/medium sized fingers.  Maybe they could offer this in different sizes? Or just be prepared to open the tail of the cat a little to adjust it.

My daughter loves this ring, and has been wearing it nonstop. And since it's Sterling Silver, it won't tarnish, rust, or turn her finger green.  This ring did take about two weeks to arrive, so just be sure to order it advance. If you need it shipped quicker, that might be an issue.

I did receive this product at a special price for an honest evaluation.
Very cute and understated. This was a present for my daughter's best friend--she loved it! it was even nicer than the picture shows!

This is a cute, but EXTREMELY tiny ring!  I was wondering how they could afford to give us real sterling silver at this price, and the answer is....there isn't much sterling silver, because the ring is so unbelievably small!

As far as the style goes, it's a very stylized Japanese maneki-neko, or "beckoning cat," which is a common good luck symbol.  It's hard to see the detail because the ring is so small, but when you are up close, it's obviously a maneki-neko.

As far as the ring diameter goes, it's very, very small.  Because it's an open ring, it can accommodate a lot of finger sizes, but right out of the box it's only about a US size 5 or less.  I have thin fingers, so I can fit it on my ring finger unadjusted, but my fingers are like toothpicks.

Because the ring is barely thicker than a piece of wire, if you grip something really hard with your hand, like a car steering wheel, or railing, you may end up distorting the ring. So this is not going to be a durable piece of jewelry.  You'd be lucky to get a few months of use out of it before it gets all banged out of shape, in my opinion.

But if you can tolerate all that, and love to collect maneki-neko pieces, this is a cute ring, even if it's not a statement or heirloom piece of jewelry.  I would put this in the category of stackable midi rings, or pinky rings----they don't have to be top quality--they're mostly just for having a little fun.

For $12, the quality is about what you would expect. Shipped from San Francisco, arrived on the East Coast in under a week. I ordered the M, and the measurements of the shirt, measured as it lays flat, are: pit-to-pit is 20 inches; length from top of the neck to the bottom hem is 27 inches; shoulder seam to wrist hem is 21.5 inches. It's not stretchy at all; the tag says 100 percent cotton and it feels like it. Had the Russian-language tag sewn on the outside of the back of the shirt. I am 5-8, 155 pounds, slim, and wear a 38/39 suit. I don't mind wearing T-shirts that are somewhat form-fitting as I am super-fit, and I usually wear a S in most shirts and T-shirts. This M fits just a bit looser than what I usually consider form-fitting, which is perfect. If this matters to you, the tag is *NOT* the tag in the photo, but it is written in Cyrillic. I've attached a photo of the tag.

The biggest problem is that the sewing isn't of great quality -- there's no real front or back -- so it bunches under the arms.

I actually also ordered another similar telnyashka shirt from another seller: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008448QQY/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1.

For some reason, the description on this latter shirt is more descriptive and includes the "240 gram/square meter" designation. The one sold as "Vintage Weave Russian Military Telnyashka" doesn't have the "240g/sm" in the description. I don't know enough about shirt weaves to tell you if it is, but it doesn't feel anymore substanstial (and maybe even less so) than a Hanes Beefy-T. Maybe this is why this is the "vintage weave" and not a genuine article? I will compare when the second shirt arrives. Paid ~$12 for the first shirt and ~$18 for the second. Am curious if they are the same shirts. I cannot imagine this is military-grade.
summary: For $12, the quality is about what you would expect.

reviewText: Tore in shoulder sleeve first wear

I own this top in three colors -- burgundy, gray, and yellow. I love it (which is why I obviously own three). I find it extremely flattering and versatile, and I get tons of compliments on it every time I wear one.

As you can see from the photos, my favorite way to wear these tops is to pair them with dark colored skinny jeans and dark brown boots. With the dark red top I also wore a blanket scarf that matched well with the red color of the top. While I went with a casual look with this top this evening, I really think this top would work just fine with a dressier look as well. I'd just switch from jeans to black skinny dress pants and from boots to heels. Instead of a scarf, I'd go with a longer necklace. It would be great for work. In fact, this is how I normally wear the yellow top

A few things about the top, the fabric is a little thin, especially on the burgundy top. I was able to work around this by adding a tank underneath that kept my bra from being visible. The fabric on the yellow and gray tops seem a bit thicker than the burgundy one. Despite the thinness of the fabric on one shirt, all three of the tops do seem very well made. I inspected them pretty thoroughly for pulled or loose threads, and I didn't find any. I have washed all three of the tops, and they hold up exceptionally well after washing as well. I will say though that since they're a bit thin I usually use a gentle cycle and hang them to air dry.

The fabric is also very stretchy, so the large fit more like I would expect an extra large to fit. As a frame of reference (see the photo) I'm a size 14, and I had plenty of extra room in this top. For a tunic, I don't really think that's a bad thing. It's just something to be aware of when choosing a size. Overall, I found the top to be very flattering. My stomach is usually my problem area, and this top is very forgiving because it's so flowy in that area. Also, it manages to be roomy in the stomach area without looking like a maternity top. I think this is because the volume of the extra fabric is in the sides not the front.

The top does tend to wrinkle a bit, but I didn't iron it. I just misted it with water and smoothed the wrinkles out. That seemed to do the trick perfectly.

Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

reviewText:
Arrived on time and looks cute. Comes with the dress, gold belt, headband/crown, and 2 silver(?!) wrist cuffs. I purchased a blue petticoat separately, which really helps the dress look flouncy.

I will likely take in the waist by accentuating the darting at the front, which will hopefully also fix the flat chest cups. As other reviewers mentioned, the cups for the chest are nonexistent. reviewText:
Let me just start by saying... I LOVED this costume when I saw it on Amazon. But when I got it and tried it on, I was a little disappointed. I typically wear size 12 in jeans (I am about 150lbs). I am curvy, about 5'6, and am hourglass shaped (usually wear a 34 C bra size). I ordered a size Large, but it was HUGE on me! The upper part of the dress was really loose. I would have had to have DDD size breasts to fill it out. It is also very cheaply made, which was surprising considering the $50 they are charging for it. It came to below my knees and I ordered a tule skirt to go under the dress to make the skirt poof out a little bit (if you don't, it just falls flat and doesn't look as good). I also am using cute, chunky red high heels and donning bright red lipstick to complete the look. Also, I know it's petty, but the cuffs were silver and that threw me off. I don't like that it doesn't match the rest of the outfit... Lol.
I started the process to return this dress and ask for a refund, in which I will order a size Medium instead and pray that it fits! If not, I will have to have it hemmed to fit me better. I'll update my review & post a photo when I get the new order to give you an idea of what it looks like on an average size woman.
summary: A few considerations before you order...

The bodice it not just "too big" it was not designed/sewn properly to fit a woman.  I took it to a professional seamstress to have it modified to fit me (I am a size 12 and bought XL); she informed me she would have to take the costume totally apart and rebuild it properly.  More specifically, the cups are molded but sit too high on the bodice in portion to the wasteline.  The sections of the bodice aren't molded to fit how and where our breasts sit on the torso.  Her assessment was whomever created the pattern didn't use a mannequin and/or used a smaller pattern and expand it larger for the bigger sizes but it wasn't porportional.  Bottom line is that I couldn't wear it and it does not fit like shown on the model.  I assume this model is flat chested so the molded breasts create the illusion she is fitting into it.  The length was very nice at knee length.
summary: Do not buy it - let me tell you why

I've ordered a set of 3 plugs from Mystic Metals before (the package that comes with opalite and tigers eye), and I really liked those, so I thought I'd order another package in different stones for my new size.  These plugs are really beautiful, they have a nice finish, and they all match well.  However, I have to agree with other reviewers that they're a little on the large side.  The wearable area is a 4g, but there is a little bulb type thing on the end of the plugs (on the amethyst, most of all) that is bigger than a 4g.  That made it difficult to insert for me, as my ears are only recently stretched to a 4g, and I'd never worn double flares (not that these ARE double flares, they're just not quite single flares either). For those who have more healed lobes and those who are used to double flare plugs, they'd be fine though. Just be careful!
summary: Nice plugs, but a little big.

These plugs are cute. The "white jade" looks pink in the picture, but are really white in person. Also, these plugs art definitely not stone. They're very light and break easily; one of them arrived broken straight down the middle, despite being packed tightly in a bubble sealer. So I had my husband check the hardness (he and our sons collect rocks and minerals) and the mate to the broken purple plug rated about 5, as does typical glass, whereas amethyst rates about 7. All in all, they're not bad for the price, though.

I included a picture of the broken plug. I couldn't get my camera to focus properly, but you can tell where the surface was shattered. For the record, the plugs are not pretty swirls of color like stone plugs typically are; the variations in the picture are due to cracks and fissures catching the light. The actually jewelry is a flat, even color.
